extendedIngredients.name: beer
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 cup beer, preferably lager or pilsner

extendedIngredients.name: tilapia
extendedIngredients.original: 1-1 1/4 lbs tilapia, or other firm white fish, sliced into 1/2-inch-by-2-inch strips
extendedIngredients.originalName: tilapia, or other firm white fish, sliced into 1/2-inch-by-2-inch strips

title: Baja-battered Fish
summary: Baja-battered Fish is a dairy free and pescatarian recipe with 40 servings. For 23 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 30 calories, 3g of protein, and 1g of fat. If you have beer, pastry flour, flour, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. This recipe from Eating Well has 114 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 48 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 17%, this dish is rather bad. Try Beer-battered Fish Tacos with Baja Sauce, Beer Battered Fish Tacos w/ Baja Sauce, and Baja Beer-Battered Tilapia (Great for Fish Tacos) for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Ziobaffan Organic Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.6 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ziobaffa Organic Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ziobaffa Organic Pinot Grigio has fresh rich aromas of apples and pears with hints of citrus that fade into a floral bouquet and on the palate it is bright and fresh with wonderful fruit flavors.ZIOBAFFA Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif. Blend: 100% Pinot Grigio

instructions: Make Ahead Tip: The fish is best when served immediately, but will keep, wrapped, in the refrigerator for up to 1 day.
